title: Street to Water Street, Traffic Safety Improvements, Report CLSFS23-024 – 2022 Investment Report, Report CLSCLK23-009 – Approval of Temporary Patio Extensions of Liquor Licensed Premises be passed as part of the Consent Agenda.

That Council approve the recommendations outlined in Report IPSPL23-010, dated April 3, 2023, of the Commissioner of Infrastructure and Planning Services as follows: a) That Section 3.9, Exceptions of Zoning By-law 1997-123 be amended to add Exception .355 which identifies a site-specific regulation to ensure that the parking area is designed to permit forward-facing access to an arterial street; and b) That the subject property be rezoned from D.2 – Development District to R.2, 4k,10a – 355 – Residential District, in accordance with the draft amendment attached as Exhibit ‘C’ to Report IPSPL23-010.

a) That Section 4.2 – Policies for Specific Residential Properties of the Official Plan, be amended by adding Section 4.2.4.21 to permit a maximum density of 397 dwelling units per hectare for the property known as 539 George Street North in accordance with the Draft Amendment attached as Exhibit D of Report IPSPL23- 012; b) That Section 3.9, Exceptions of Zoning By-law 1997-123 be amended by adding Exception Number 357 to prescribe site specific regulations for the property known as 539 George Street North in accordance with the Draft Amendment attached as Exhibit E of Report IPSPL23-012; c) That the subject property be rezoned from C.6 – Commercial District to C.6- 357-H – Commercial District in accordance with the Draft Amendment attached as Exhibit E of Report IPSPL23-012; and d) That the ‘H’ Holding Symbol be removed at such time as: 1. Site Plan Approval has been granted for the property, which will include the following requirements: i. The Owner shall make any necessary improvements to the laneway, to the City's satisfaction, in support of the proposed development; and ii. The Owner will be responsible for all financial costs associated with the improvements.

That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report COU23-003 dated April 11, 2023 as follows: a) That City Council approve the Strategic Plan attached to Report COU23-003 as Appendix A. b) That the words, “the arts” be included in the Community and Wellbeing section of Appendix A.

That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report CSSS23-015 dated April 24, 2023 of the Commissioner of Community Services as follows: That staff be authorized to proceed as outlined in Report CSSS23-015 dated April 24, 2023 of the Commissioner of Community Services, “544 McDonnel Street Municipal Housing Project Facilities Agreement”, as amended.

That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report COU23-004 dated April 24, 2023, of the Mayor Jeff Leal as follows: That Council direct staff to proceed as recommended in Closed Session Report COU23-004 dated April 24, 2023, of the Mayor respecting the CAO’s compensation level. That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report CSSS23-015 dated April 24, 2023 of the Commissioner of Community Services as follows: That staff be authorized to proceed as outlined in Report CSSS23-015 dated April 24, 2023 of the Commissioner of Community Services, “544 McDonnel Street Municipal Housing Project Facilities Agreement”, as amended. That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report CSD23-008, dated April 24, 2023, of the Commissioner of Community Services, and the Commissioner of Corporate and Legislative Services as follows: That staff be authorized to proceed as outlined in Closed Session Report CSSS23-008 dated April 24, 2023 of the Commissioner of Community Services and the Commissioner of Corporate and Legislative Services, as amended.
That staff be authorized to proceed as outlined in Closed Session Report IPSPL23-015, dated April 24, 2023, of the Commissioner of Infrastructure and Planning Services and the City Solicitor.

That staff be authorized to proceed as outlined in Closed Session Report IPSPL23-015, dated April 24, 2023, of the Commissioner of Infrastructure and Planning Services and the City Solicitor. That Council approve the recommendations outlined in Report CLSCLK23-012, dated April 24, 2023, of the City Clerk, on behalf of the Citizen Appointment Selection Committee and the Mayor, as follows: a) That Jef Dueck and Bruce Bozec be appointed to serve as members of the Arenas, Parks and Recreation Advisory Committee (APRAC) with terms until December 2026; and, b) That Councillor Kevin Duguay be appointed as per the Mayor’s recommendation to the Transit Liaison Committee (TLC) with a term until November 2026.
That By-law 23-054 be deleted. That By-law 23-052 be approved. 23-052 Being a By-law to amend the Zoning By-law for the lands known as 1194 Parkhill Road West
